qas.question: In what year did Everton's second successful era begin?
Who was the manager when Everton's second successful era began in 1961?
In what year did Everton win the FA cup in a 3-2 win over Sheffield?
In what year did Everton lose the FA cup final to West Bromwich Albion?
What was the last year that Harry Catterick managed Everton?
What was the score of the first Everton game Harry Catterick managed?
What was the score of the final game between Everton and West Bromwich Albion in 1968?
Who coached Everton during the 1969-70 season?
Who coached Everton during the 1966-67 season?

context: Everton's second successful era started when <a1_0><b7_0><b8_0>Harry Catterick<b8_0/><b7_0/><a1_0/> was made manager in <a0_0><b4_0>1961<b4_0/><a0_0/>. In 1962–63, his second season in charge, Everton won the League title and in <a2_0>1966<a2_0/> the FA Cup followed with a <b5_0><b6_0>3–2<b6_0/><b5_0/> win over Sheffield Wednesday. Everton again reached the final in 1968, but this time were unable to overcome West Bromwich Albion at <a3_0>Wembley<a3_0/>. Two seasons later in 1969–70, Everton won the League championship, nine points clear of nearest rivals Leeds United. During this period, Everton were the first English club to achieve five consecutive years in European competitions—seasons 1961–62 to 1966–67.
